meanings.definition: A water-soluble vitamin of the B complex, found in various foods, especially liver, yeast, and whole grains, and necessary for carbohydrate metabolism and normal neural activity.
meanings.sent1: Thiamin is important for our body to use carbohydrates.
meanings.sent2: I make sure to eat liver and whole grains to get enough thiamin.
meanings.sent3: Without thiamin, our bodies might get confused about how to use food!
meanings.sent4: Thiamin is like a spark plug for our energy from food.
meanings.sent5: Remember to include thiamin-rich foods in your diet for a healthy nervous system.
